result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Breyon M.K. Wright

Defendant Breyon M.K. Wright not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V appeared by video for Breyon M.K. Wright.  Attorney Claire E Zyber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 12-7-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 1-17-23 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 6 person scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Discharge Report forwarded to the Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Breyon M.K. Wright not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V appeared by video for Breyon M.K. Wright.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Bastien is new to the case and is requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 10-14-22 at 8:30 am for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:

Received and Filed. Justice Point Violation (New Criminal Charges)
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Breyon M.K. Wright in court with attorney Megan Kaldunski.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Breyon M.K. Wright appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: William Del Moral, Milwaukee Police Department Office.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.

For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel motion to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney Kaldunski informed the Court that attorney JP Bastien will be taking over the case.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Breyon M.K. Wright in court with attorney Megan Kaldunski.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Court vacated previously issued stayed bench warrant. Case needs a preliminary hearing.  Case is adjourned to 8-9-22 at 8:30 am for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Megan Kaldunski in court.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Order to Show Cause Hearing held.  Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests a calendar call date.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $1,500.00 .  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. No contact order monitoring only.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Breyon M.K. Wright in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Breyon M.K. Wright in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
